metrics.measurement: Explicitly link the solution to a high-level strategic goal (e.g., AI-driven revenue growth, Operational scalability) rather than just technical implementation.
Discuss the 'Future State'â€”how their organization will operate differently with this Data/AI strategy, not just which tools they will use.
Translate technical features (e.g., Looker dashboards, GenAI models) into business outcomes (e.g., Reducing customer churn by 15%, Accelerating time-to-market).
Did you quantify the cost of their current problem? (e.g., 'How much is this data silo costing you annually in lost productivity?')
Did you confirm who signs the check and ask to involve them? (e.g., 'Who else needs to see these numbers for budget approval?')
Did you map the steps to signature? (e.g., 'Once we agree on the tech, does this go to procurement or legal? How long does that take?')
Did you test your Champion? (e.g., 'Can you get this data to the CFO by Friday?' vs. just hoping they will help).
Did you teach them something new about their industry or data strategy that they didn't know? (e.g., 'Most companies try X with AI, but fail because Y...').
Did you use industry data/benchmarks to make the problem feel urgent and expensive? (e.g., 'Competitors adopting GenAI in this sector are seeing 2x efficiency...').
Did you push back or 'Take Control' when the customer drifted? (e.g., 'I understand you want to see a demo, but without understanding X, the demo won't make sense.').
